intro: Anasser borboniae, commonly known as the Bourbon anasser, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in shaded, moist environments within the rainforest canopy. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
